N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-3.4 - Request for special equalization rate and certified change in level of assessment factor

State Regulations
(a) School tax
apportionment. The assessor of a city or town may submit a written request for
a special equalization rate for purposes of school tax apportionment where
there has been a change in the level of assessment since the establishment of
the State equalization rate for the prior roll. (b) Exemptions for alterations and
improvements to multiple dwellings. The assessor of a city to which the
multiple dwelling law is applicable may request the certification of a change
in level of assessment factor for purposes of section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law. (c) Assessment of special franchise property. The assessor or an owner of special franchise property may submit a written
request for a special equalization rate for the purpose of determining
assessments of special franchise property. (d) A request pursuant to this section must
be filed with ORPTS not later than 30 days prior to the last date set by law
for the filing of the final assessment roll. (e) Upon receipt of such request, ORPTS will
advise the assessor, county director, and if appropriate, the school district
officials that a special equalization rate or certified change in level of
assessment factor may be determined in accordance with this Subpart. (f) If a special equalization rate or
certified change in level of assessment factor is established, ORPTS will
notify the assessor, county director, and if appropriate, the school district
officials, of the special equalization rate or certified change in level of
assessment factor. If the request is denied, the notification to the same
parties shall state the reason for the denial. Notes
